thread.title: Lin overpowers old rival Lee to reach All England semis

title: Lin overpowers old rival Lee to reach All England semis
text: March 16, 2018 / 9:47 PM / Updated 14 hours ago Lin overpowers old rival Lee to reach All England semis Reuters Staff 1 Min Read (Reuters) - China’s Lin Dan beat his old rival and defending champion Lee Chong Wei of Malaysia 21-16 21-17 in the All England Open quarter-finals in Birmingham on Friday. Badminton - Yonex All England Open Badminton Championships - Arena Birmingham, Birmingham, Britain - March 16, 2018 China's Lin Dan celebrates victory in the men's singles quarter final Action Images via Reuters/Peter Cziborra The 34-year-old Lin, twice Olympic gold medallist, won six points in a row to take the first game and edged out Lee in a tight second to seal victory in 51 minutes and move closer to a seventh All England title. Slideshow (6 Images) Korean Son Wan-ho defeated Japan’s Kenta Nishimoto 21-18 9-21 21-14 and China’s Shi Yuqi overcame compatriot Chen Long 21-10 21-17 to also reach the semi-finals. China’s Huang Yuxiang beat Indian Prannoy Kumar 20-22 21-16 23-21 in the last quarter-final. Reporting by Ed Osmond; Editing by Ken Ferris
